properties.title: Test your knowledge of R graphics

children.value: Which of the following is a contributed R package?

That’s correct! ggplot2 was developed by Hadley Wickham as part of his
PhD.
No, this is a core package so it’s already installed.
No, this a core package and loads automatically when you launch R.
No, this a core package and loads automatically when you launch R.
Which R package actually renders the graphics in R?

Remember that there are two primary graphic models in R: the base and
grid graphics. Which one is ggplot2 using?

properties.title: Plotting two or more variables with ggplot2

children.value: For the following questions we are going to use

package which contains the budget share of food for Spanish
households. You can load the dataset and see the structure of the data
below.
The meaning of the variables are described below:

: percentage of total expenditure which the household has
spent on food
: age of reference person in the household

: size of the town where the household is placed categorized
into 5 groups: 1 for small towns, 5 for big ones

Try to recreate the scatter plot below. Is there anything unusual that
you notice about the plot?

for the bottom left region. Let’s try to create a

Let’s have a look at the distribution of the percentage of total
expenditure which the household has spent on food (

). We’ll
adjust the bin width of the

to 0.001. Do you notice the
peak at 0?

instead of density.

. There are not that many observations where sex
information is missing so let’s focus on

children.value: argument to change the width of the boxplot.

In the next target plot, we want to draw a scatter plot between the size
of the household and the total expenditure of the household. Then we
want to overlay this with a loess curve in red color. You may not have
seen how to fit a curve on

yet so check out the hint if you
don’t know.

children.value: can draw curves from a fitted model.
In the next plot, try drawing a

by the different sexes with
the total count written on top of the bar.

children.value:
Hint: change the stat of one of the geometry used to write the count to
compute the total count to be used on the y axis.

The next one might be tricky. You want to draw a bar plot showing the
average total expenditure of by sex and town but the top blue bars show
the average for women, while the bottom red bars show the average for
men.

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; max-width: 790px;
display: block

properties.title: plot 06 07E 1

children.value:
with a label “woman” and “man”. In
this case should

In the plot below, we show the age distribution by man and woman. Change
the color so the violin plot for the man colored as “violet” and woman
as “royalblue”.

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; max-width: 790px;
display: block

properties.style: width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;

children.value: Hint: Recall that scales are controlled by functions beginning with
. The second “word” in the scale function is the aesthetic.

In the next plot, let’s have a look at the distribution of the total
household expenditure by sex using histograms. Since hte total household
expenditure skewed to the right, take a log with base 10 transformation
for the scale and change the colors like the target plot below.

properties.style: position: relative; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; max-width: 790px;
display: block

properties.title: plot 06 09B 1
properties.style: width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;

children.value: Hint: Recall that scales are controlled by functions beginning with
. The second “word” in the scale function is the aesthetic.

In the following section, we won’t give you much hints! Try to reach the
target plots by seeing what’s drawn in the target plot and complete the
code needed to get to the target plot.

Hint: what variable is the data facetted by? If you want to see the grey
shadow of the overall distribution for each panel, remember that the
variable needs to be removed from the layer data.

both x and y directions.

separate plots.

properties.title: Customise the look with themes in ggplot2

children.value: Well done getting to the last practice exercise!

The next plot you’re going to draw is the plot below – or make the plot
as pretty as you can!

children.value:
Hint: Theme options for ggplot2 are customised in the theme() function.
You specify how a particular target (say the text) is shown using the
appropriate

ggplot2: elegant graphics for data
analysis

R for data science slack
community

frontmatter.title: Chapter 6: Data visualisation with R
frontmatter.description: This chapter will give you an introduction to the R graphics system and teach you how to get started with using the ggplot2 package for drawing all kind of plots.
